description.p: You place a randomised curse on a creature that you can see within range. Roll a d6 and assign a number to each of the six ability scores (1 is Strength, 2 is Dexterity, 3 is Constitution, 4 is Intelligence, 5 is Wisdom, 6 is Charisma). The target has disadvantage on any ability checks or saving throws using the rolled ability score.
If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.
A remove curse cast on the target ends this spell early.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or higher, you can roll an additional d6 for every two spell levels above 3rd, choosing between the results.

element.name: Arishka’s Erasure
element.supports: Bard, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Weaver, Wizard

description.p: You reach out and touch a creature with dark magic. The target must succeed a Constitution saving throw or have their temporary hit points reduced to 0.

A wave of energy washes over you and those who you choose within range. You have a pool of 8 temporary hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures that you can see within range. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the pool of temporary hit points increases by 8 for every level above 1st.

element.name: Bind Weapon
element.supports: Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Ranger, Weaver, Wizard

description.p: You touch a weapon and bind it to your service. When a creature other than yourself attempts to pick up your weapon, they must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take 5d10 psychic damage and be forced to drop the weapon. On a success, nothing happens. You can only have a single weapon bound this way, and binding another weapon through this spell destroys your bind to your previous weapon.

setters.set: a weapon in which to bind

description.p: You call upon the power of death to protect you. You gain 40 temporary hit points, plus an additional 10 temporary hit points for every corpse of a CR 1/8 or higher creature within 60 feet of you. The temporary hit points are lost when the spell ends.

Celestial light flows from your hand, restoring those in front of you. Each creature in a 30-foot cone regains a number of hit points equal to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points within range, you can forcibly rip open the ethereal veil as their soul begins to depart. Each creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 force damage on a success and half as much on a failure.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take when a creature in range has been reduced to 0 hitpoints

description.p: You conjure a 30 foot sphere at a point you can see within range. The sphere has a soft, hazy look to it. The sphere is filled with pure, clean air which suppresses water or unclean air from entering the sphere. Any overpowering stench becomes much more manageable for creatures inside the sphere, regardless of whether the source of the smell is outside or inside the sphere. Any spell or magical effect of 4th level or lower that creates a toxic cloud or similar magic cannot enter the sphere. The sphere does not penetrate full cover.
You can choose to concentrate on this spell to pause its duration until you choose to stop concentrating, or to move the sphere at a speed of 30 feet to another location.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the sphere resists magic of an additional level higher for each spell level above 4th.

setters.set: A short reed or piece of straw

description.p: You call to the spiritual world and manifest ghostly totems at up to 5 corpses you can see within range. These totems are ethereal in their appearance and occupy the space of the corpse they are created in. A creature that moves within 15 feet of a totem for the first time on their turn must succeed an Intelligence saving throw or take 3d6 psychic damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, an additional totem is created at their corpse.
The space the totem occupies is considered difficult terrain for the duration.

setters.set: A short reed or piece of straw

description.p: You target a creature within range, lashing out at any creatures nearby. Creatures within 5 feet of the target (excluding the target themselves) must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take 1d8 force damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th Level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. At the end of your turn, you teleport back to the space that you cast this spell from. If that space is occupied or blocked, you instead safely teleport to the nearest unoccupied space.
You bolster a targets resistance against a damage type. For the duration, the willing creature you touch has immunity to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, you can choose one additional damage type. You must provide the materials for this spell.

setters.set: A dragon’s scale of the elemental type you choose, worth at least 1000gp

description.p: You imbue an object you touch that is no larger than a 5 foot cube with magical energy. The monetary value of the object is treated as 10 times larger for the duration. Creatures that succeed a Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC learn that the object has been influenced by this spell. The objects appearance turns to that of a light shimmering gold for the duration.
Casting midas touch again will cause any previous instances of this spell you have cast to revert to its original monetary value and appearance.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases indefinitely, ending the spell when you die.

setters.set: An object with a monetary value

description.p: You channel flaming energy into an arrow you hold, knocking it into your bow, enchanting it with flames. When you let go of the arrow, an ethereal flaming phoenix conjures up and follows a straight path from you out to a maximum of 120 feet. The line ignores half and three quarter cover, and is stopped by any solid, non-flammable material more than 1 foot thick. Each creature within 5 feet of this line must succeed a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take 6d12 fire damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is turned to ash. The ash is considered an intact corpse under the effects of the gentle repose spell for the purposes of resurrection magic.

setters.set: A non-magical arrow, which the spell consumes

description.p: You animate a quill to precisely duplicate any form of non-magical writing you see. The pen writes on a piece of parchment used as the material component, completing one standard page every casting of this spell.

setters.set: a quill, ink and a piece of parchment

description.p: You conjure a synergised bolt, striking with equal part radiant and necrotic energy. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature in range. On a hit, you deal 5d8 radiant and 5d8 necrotic damage to the target. The target must succeed a Constitution saving throw or gain a level of exhaustion.

You lash out with electric energy at an aggressor. As a reaction when a creature within range attempts a melee attack against you, the creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the beginning of their next turn.

setters.set: 1 reaction, taken when a melee attack is made against you

description.p: You call upon the winds to guide you. A powerful wind begins to blow in a 60 foot cube around a location you target. The wind causes creatures inside to have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws for the duration. If you target an object with this spell, the winds follow it. Any walls or objects more than a foot deep stop the wind. A creature immune or resistant to weather effects is unaffected by this spell.
If you are on a boat or ship, you can cast this spell on a mast. The spell creates a wind strong enough to fill the sails of one ship, increasing its speed by 5 miles per hour for the duration.

You touch a creature, adjusting their natural frequency to cause a resonating effect, shattering the bonds that hold their form together. A creature you touch must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 8d10+20 thunder damage. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.

You manipulate a horde of gold, alchemically altering it into a non-magical material component for a spell. Select any non-magical material component with a value of 5,000 GP or below. The chosen component must be for a spell that you know. You touch an amount of gold coins equal to 25% more than the component’s cost. Over the course of casting the spell, the gold coins are transmuted into the spell component. If you are interrupted while casting this spell, it fails and the gold coins disappear.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum value of the components increase by 5,000gp for each spell level above 3rd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the maximum value for the component is unlimited.

setters.set: gold coins, worth 25% more than the component being transmuted

description.p: Using your knowledge of light, you conjure searing bolts that strike targets you choose. You cast 6 bolts that you can divide amongst up to 6 creatures of your choice within range and line of sight. Make a spell attack roll against each target. If you target someone with two or more bolts, only make one attack roll. Each bolt deals 1d4 radiant damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you conjure two additional bolts for each spell level above 2nd.

You create a blast of light that seeks a single target you can see within range. The target takes 2d6 fire damage, and cannot take the hide action or become invisible until the beginning of your next turn.

You alter the very fundamental identity of up to 6 willing creatures within range. Choose one of the following: aberration, beast, celestial, construct, dragon, elemental, fey, fiend, giant, monstrosity, ooze, plant, or undead. For the duration, all targeted creature types are treated as the option you chose.
You or any of the targeted creatures can end this effect on themselves as an action.

setters.set: A heart from a creature of the type you choose

description.p: You touch the ground, shaping it into a pillar beneath your feet. The pillar lifts you 20 feet into the air, on a circular platform of 5 feet diameter. Any creature sharing the space with you is also lifted onto the platform by this spell. If a creature is within 5 feet of your space and not sharing the space with you when you cast this spell, they must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

setters.set: Earth, stone or brick at your feet

description.p: You lash out with violent energy, attempting to split the soul of your targets. All targets in a 30 foot cone from the direction you are facing must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target has their maximum hit points reduced by half for 8 hours. If a target has more current hit points than half their maximum hit points, they are reduced to this new maximum.

An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects the target. Until the start of the targets next turn, the target has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and the target takes no damage from magic missile.

setters.set: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range is hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

description.p: You wash a wave of supportive magic over a downed creature within range that has failed a death saving throw. The target removes any failed death saving throws it has made.

setters.set: 1 reaction, taken when a creature within range fails a death saving throw.

description.p: You draw the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a ranged attack with it against one creature within the weapon's range. On a hit, the target must succeed a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. A Large creature or larger has advantage on this saving throw.
At 5th level, the attack deals an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage to the target on a hit. This damage increases by 1d8 at 11th level (2d8) and again at 17th level (3d8).

setters.set: A ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

description.p: You accelerate the air around your hand before striking. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target isn't wearing armour. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 slashing damage.
The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th Level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You sing a soft melody, causing a target to become drowsy. Targets must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target subtracts a d4 to Dexterity and Wisdom saving throws they make, and their speed is reduced by 10 feet. In addition, if a target by this spell is targeted by sleep or similar magic, treat the creatures maximum hit points as half their maximum hit points for the purposes of sleeping the target.
The die the target subtracts increases by one step at 5th level (d6), 11th level (d8), and 17th level (d10).

element.name: Mental Reconstruction
element.description: You attune your senses, allowing you to piece together an object in your mind. When you cast this spell, you touch a piece from any broken object, and you learn how it looks when it is whole. You can make out any markings, as well as any missing pieces from the area around it. There must be at least half of the broken object's pieces within 500 feet, or else the spell fails.

description.p: You unleash a powerful toxic bolt, magically guiding it towards a target of your choice within range. The target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 poison damage and have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell until the beginning of your next turn.
The spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You utter an invocation that temporarily shields you from harm. You gain 1d4 + 1 temporary hit points that last until the beginning of your next turn. While these temporary hit points persist, your ability scores, armour class, and speed cannot be reduced.
The temporary hit points increase by 1d4 + 1 at 5th level (2d4 + 2), 11th level (3d4 + 3, and 17th level (4d4 + 4)

setters.set: A piece of a guard's uniform

description.p: You touch two objects. A visible, ethereal, ghostly tether binds those objects. The two objects cannot be moved more than 5 feet away from each other, except by magical means. The tether is dispelled If the objects are further away than 5 feet or the tether is reduced to 0 hit points. The tether has 14 AC and 5 hit points.
This spell's survivability increases by 2 AC and 5 hit points when you reach 5th level (16 AC and 10 hit points), 11th level (18 AC and 15 hit points), and 17th level (20 AC and 20 hit points).

setters.set: Two mundane objects to be tethered

description.p: You can drain the life out of a creatures limbs or their vocal chords for a short time. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either muted or bound (your choice) for the duration. A muted creature cannot speak except through telepathy, and they cannot perform verbal components for any spells they may be able to cast. A bound creature has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls they make and they cannot perform somatic components for any spells they may be able to cast. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

You swear a covenant with another creature, binding yourselves to a promise. When you cast this spell, both of you speak the same promise, or a reflection of each others promise. While under the effects of this covenant, neither creature can willingly break the sworn promise. A creature only has to obey the written meaning of the covenant, not necessarily the intended meaning.

Both creatures must be willing to swear the covenant at the moment of hearing the other creatures promise, or the covenant fails and the spell slot is lost. The covenant ends if either creature dies, or if another covenant is sworn between the same two creatures.

setters.set: Blood from both creatures swearing the covenant

description.p: You target one magical light or magical darkness source that is no larger than a 60 foot sphere you can see within range. The radius of the light or dark source is doubled, expanding out to reach that distance 5 feet per round. This spells duration becomes the same as the remaining duration of the light or dark source that was targeted. If the light or dark source that was targeted does not have a duration, the effect lasts for 24 hours. This spell has no effect on a light or dark source under the effects of an instance of this spell.

You touch between two to six mundane objects, designating one to be the centre of this spell. A visible, ethereal, ghostly tether binds those objects, all attaching to the centre object. The objects bound this way cannot be moved more than 15 feet away from the centre object, except by magical means. If an object is further away than 15 feet, that single tether is dispelled while the rest remain. If the tether is reduced to 0 hit points, it is dispelled. Each tether has 10 AC and 20 hit points.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or higher, the AC for each tether increases by 2 for each spell level above 2nd.

setters.set: Two to six mundane objects, to be tethered

description.p: You drain the light from a nearby object, and coalesce the light in your palm. The light diffracts into five beams of coloured light. Each beam hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. Each creature you target must make a Dexterity saving throw. If a creature is targeted by multiple beams, they must make multiple saving throws. The following beams and effects are created.
Red. The target takes 4d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Orange. The target takes 4d8 acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Yellow. The target takes 4d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Green. The target takes 4d8 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Blue. The target takes 4d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

setters.set: A source of light within 60 feet

description.p: You touch a creature, adjusting their natural frequency to cause a resonating effect, shattering the bonds that hold their form together. A creature you touch must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 8d10+20 thunder damage. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.

You coat your skin with arcing electricity that strikes back at any aggressors. When a melee attack roll succeeds to hit you, the attacker takes 1d6 lightning damage. This effect triggers after the attack is made, but before multiattack is considered.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage you deal is increased by 1d6 for every second spell level above 3rd.

You channel your internal magic, causing time to disrupt around a point you choose within range. A 15 feet radius sphere is created at the target location. The sphere is coated in a shell of energy that pulsates along the outside of it, but is otherwise transparent.

Creatures that start their turn in the sphere have their speed doubled, gain a +2 bonus to AC, have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and gain an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

setters.set: A pinch of sand from an ancient hourglass

description.p: You can use your magic to delay damage dealt to you. When an attack successfully deals damage to you, you instead add this damage to a pool of damage suspended in time. This pool will gradually increase as you take more damage. When the spell ends early, you take the full value of the damage pool as force damage. If you successfully reach the end of the spell whilst maintaining concentration, the spell grants you temporary hit points equal to the amount of the damage pool, and the spell ends.

You target a creature within range with intense divination magic. You learn the target's AC, CR, saving throw proficiencies, the number of different attacks it can make, and if it has any legendary actions. Once this spell has been cast, the target becomes immune to the effect of this spell for 24 hours.

You target a pile of food or liquid within range no larger than a 5 foot cube. Any food should be continuous and any liquid should be enclosed in a container. The food or liquid is suspended in time for the duration, not decaying, spoiling or breaking down in any method.

The spell ends if the food or liquid is targeted by another instance of this spell, another magical effect or spell that alters the food or liquid in any method, or the food or liquid is used or consumed.

setters.set: Food or liquid to be preserved

description.p: As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can teleport to an unoccupied space that you occupied since the start of your last turn, and the attack misses you.

setters.set: 1 reaction, taken when another creature hits you with an attack

description.p: You place your sextant on a surface facing a strong light source. The light is absorbed by the sextant, and rescattered into the air through the device. It creates a map of the stars in a 10 feet cube above the sextant.

The stars represent the current celestial cycle and there locations. Each major navigational star is illuminated, and constellations are connected. The map has sufficient details for any creature trained in navigation tools or that is familiar with the stars to navigate distances of up to 50 miles.

setters.set: A platinum sextant, worth at least 50gp

description.p: You touch a non-magical suit of armour or clothing, channeling your magic to alter it to your desire. The attire glows softly, and the next humanoid that attempts to wear it while the spell is active will feel the attire change to fit their body type. Once the attire has been magically altered or the duration has passed, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the armour or clothing you select to be transmuted can be magical.

setters.set: armour or clothing to be transmuted

description.p: You call upon an ancient and powerful magic used by the demons against the angels. You scream a high frequency sound that forces all creatures with a flying speed within 120 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 4d10 psychic damage and loses their flying speed for the duration. If a creature is airborne and does not have the hover property, they fall to the ground. Creatures take falling damage from this fall, if it is great enough. The scream is audible up to 300 feet away.

Dusk spreads from a point you choose within range. A 10-foot radius sphere of magical darkness fills the area for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can’t see through this darkness, and non-magical light can’t illuminate it. At the beginning of each of your subsequent turns, you can choose to increase or reduce the radius of this sphere by 10 feet, to a maximum of 60 feet and a minimum of 10 feet, or you can leave the sphere as is.
If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 4th level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

setters.set: A drop of pitch or piece of coal

description.p: You target a creature within range with intense divination magic to find a weakness. You choose one of Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing damage the target is not resistant or immune to. The target becomes vulnerable to that damage type for the duration.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can select a damage type from the following instead: acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, piercing, poison, psychic, radiant, slashing, and thunder.

You conjure a small bead of light that orbits 1 foot around a willing creature you touch. While the mote orbits that creature, it emits 30 feet of bright light and 30 feet of dim light beyond this. While the spell persists, another creature other than the target can use an action to grasp or net the mote to separate it from the target, either by making a successful Attack roll or a successful Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. The AC of the mote and the DC of the check is equal to your Spell Save DC. The mote of light is destroyed if it takes any damage.

The target can use a bonus action to seize and stow the mote, suppressing its effect until they use a bonus action to reactivate the mote. You or the target can choose to end the mote at any time (no action required).
You steel yourself against attacks, ready to defend yourself. When you take damage, you reduce the damage you take by your Spellcasting ability modifier.
You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, the weapon you touch is treated as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.

setters.set: A physical weapon in which to enchant and a silver coin

description.p: You draw a sigil of magic into the air, igniting it blue and hurling the illusion of embers at creatures in front of you. All creatures in the area must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking 2d8 psychic damage on a failure or half as much on a success. Until the end of your next turn, creatures that failed their saving throw have disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every level above 1st.

You coalesce violent and explosive energy into a point you choose within range, creating a 30 foot sphere. From the outside, the sphere looks like a black orb with lightning striking throughout it. Inside the sphere, chaos and destruction reign supreme. At the beginning of each of your turns while this spell is active, each creature inside the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature within this area takes 8d8 lightning damage and is stunned until the beginning of your next turn. A creature who succeeds this saving throw takes half damage and isn't stunned. The sphere is considered difficult terrain.

As a bonus action, you can move the sphere 30 feet in any direction, or end the spell early. If you willingly end the spell early this way, then the sphere erupts with vicious force. All creatures within the sphere must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take a further 6d8 lightning damage and be stunned until the end of your next turn.

You target up to 3 creatures within range. The creatures must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be restrained. A creature bound by this spell can repeat this saving throw at the beginning of their turns. If a creature fails their repeated saving throw, they take 15 radiant damage. A celestial and fiend targeted by this spell have disadvantage on the saving throw.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of targets increases by 1 and the damage increases by 5 for every level above 7th.

You evoke a blade of equal parts light and dark in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a longsword, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action. You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 radiant and 2d6 necrotic damage. As a free action on your turn, you can conceal yourself and the area around you in your choice of light or darkness.

The blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet if you choose light, or magical darkness out to 20 feet if you choose darkness. You can change the state of the blade as a reaction to another creatures action.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage of the weapon increases by 1d6 radiant and 1d6 necrotic damage for every two levels above 4th.

setters.set: A source of darkness and a source of light

description.p: You conjure a temporary saddle made of mithryl on a creature you touch. The creature must be capable of mounting a humanoid of medium size or smaller, and must be of size large or higher. The reins transmute themselves to fit perfectly on the mount. While under the effects of this spell, any walking, flying, burrowing or swimming speed is doubled for the duration. In addition, two humanoids of size medium or smaller can ride the mount.

setters.set: A strap from a saddle and a piece of mithryl

description.p: You temporarily heighten your senses to feel the vibrations in the area around you. You can automatically pinpoint the location of any object or creature within 30 feet that is in contact with the ground.

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration increases to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases to 1 hour.

You bless the ground around you, allowing fruit, crops and flowers to grow better and stronger. While the spell persists, any plant life in a 1 mile radius centred on you grows 10 times as quickly, and any yield gathered within this area produces three times the results. Any ingredients harvested from this area will be of the utmost quality and cleared of any toxins. The area doesn't move with you and when you cast this spell again, your previous instance of this spell ends.

setters.set: A seed from a rare plant, worth at least 500gp, which the spell consumes

description.p: You conjure a dark and booming storm cloud at a point you choose within range. A 60 foot sphere of lightning lingers in the air for the duration.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity saving throw. taking 5d8 lightning damage and is deafened on a failure, taking half damage and isn't deafened on a success. The creature is deaf so long as it remains within the cloud's area, but recovers without a save when they leave it. A creature must make this save whenever they enter the sphere.

You plant a seed into the soil, nursing it for the duration of the casting time. Upon casting the spell, the seed will begin to grow into a beautiful, extremely large oak tree. The seed will take a year to grow to its maximum height of 3000 feet, with a trunk of diameter 500 feet. If any object is blocking the trees growth, the object is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space. If there is no such space, the obstacle is consumed by the tree.

The tree's trunk is hollow, and it the sheer size and strength of the tree allows a village to be created on and inside it. The tree can support and nourish 200 people. Any creature within 10 miles of this tree feels its vitality, and requires half the amount of rations they normally would to survive. Creatures within 1 mile of the tree are completely sustained by the trees magic, no longer requiring food and drink. Creatures can choose to attune to the tree, taking up one of their attunement slots. If they choose to do so, they do not require food or drink even when outside the reach of the World Tree.

The World Tree can only be destroyed through a cataclysmic event, such as a meteor, a volcano erupting, a tsunami or an earthquake of unimaginable magnitude. If the World Tree is destroyed, it drops a seed that can be used as material to cast this spell again.

setters.set: A seed from a previous World Tree, which the spell consumes, and soft, fertile ground in which to plant it
